name: Sheperd's Pie
instructions: Trim lamb of excess fat and cut into one inch cubes.  Season with salt and pepper.
In a dutch oven heat the oil over medium high heat.
In batches to avoid crowding, add the lamb cubes and cook turning occassioally until browned on all sides. About five minutes per batch, transfer to a plate.
add 4 tbs butter to dutch oven and melt over medium heat.
Add the onion, carrots, celery and garlic, cover and cook stirring occasionally, until the carrots are tender crisp, about five minutes.
Uncover, sprinkle with flour, and stir well.
Gradually stir in the broth and whine, rosemary, bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently.
Return lamb to the dutch oven, cover and place in the oven and cook until the lamb is tender about 1 1/2 hours.
